sen.j: 舞鶴線（まいづるせん）は、京都府綾部市の綾部駅から京都府舞鶴市の東舞鶴駅に至る西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の鉄道路線（地方交通線）である。
sen.e: Maizuru Line is a railway, running from Ayabe Station in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, to Higashi-Maizuru Station in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, owned by West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and the line is one of Secondary Lines, which are handled distinctively from main lines because of having relatively small number of passengers.
sen.cmt: 「地方交通線」については説明を要するところですが、「利用客が比較的少ないために幹線とは区別して扱われる線路のこと」としました。
sen.e: The Maizuru Line is a regional branch line railway, owned by West Japan Railway Company (JR West), that runs from Ayabe Station in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, to Higashi-Maizuru Station in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: "branch line" might not be an exact translation but I think it gets the idea across.
sen.e: The Maizuru Line is a regional branch line railway, owned by West Japan Railway Company (JR West), that runs from Ayabe Station in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, to Higashi-Maizuru Station in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 大日本帝国海軍の舞鶴鎮守府が置かれ、軍港として発展した舞鶴への鉄道として建設された。
sen.e: It was laid as a railway to Maizuru City, where Imperial Japanese Navy once established Maizuru Naval Headquarters, and thereafter the development of the naval port was seen.
sen.cmt: 正確には、1938年まで「舞鶴」は「市」ではなく幾つかの「町」の集まりにすぎませんでした。しかし、ここでの「舞鶴」は「現在の舞鶴市が存在する地域」というニュアンスである、と解して'City'を付しています。
sen.e: It was constructed to serve Maizuru, which had grown as a naval port following the installation of an Imperial Naval base.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence.Although it is common to add "City" to Japanese city names, it isn't really that common in English and I feel it isn't necessary, especially in this case.
sen.e: It was constructed to serve Maizuru, which had grown as a naval port following the installation of an Imperial Naval base.

sen.j: かつて出征者や引揚者の輸送で賑わった路線も現在は舞鶴市などへのビジネス利用や丹後国・嶺南への観光路線となっている。
sen.e: Once crowded with transported soldiers or repatriates, the railway is now used for a business trip to Maizuru City and around, or for a sightseeing trip in regions like Tango province and Reinan (the former is today's northern part of Kyoto Prefecture and the latter is the coastal area along Wakasa Bay in southern part of Fukui Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「丹後国」・「嶺南」もそれぞれ説明を付す必要があると思われ、「現在の京都府北部」及び「福井県南部にある、若狭湾沿岸の地域」としておきました。。
sen.e: Once crowded with departing and repatriated soldiers, the railway is now used by people traveling to the Maizuru area on business or for sightseeing trips to Tango province in northern Kyoto Prefecture and Reinan in southern Fukui Prefecture.
sen.cmt: "transported"→"departing""repatriates"→"repatriated soldiers"Reworded sentence for clarity, though still incorporated the original translation's explanations of the Japanese.
sen.e: Once crowded with departing and repatriated soldiers, the railway is now used by people traveling to the Maizuru area on business or for sightseeing trips to Tango province in northern Kyoto Prefecture and Reinan in southern Fukui Prefecture.

sen.j: 全区間西日本旅客鉄道福知山支社の直轄である（1991年4月から2006年6月までは、同支社舞鶴鉄道部の管轄であった）。
sen.e: The entire line is now under the direct control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama Branch; from April of 1991 to June of 2006, the control had been delegated to the Fukuchiyama Branch's Maizuru Railway Division.
sen.cmt: 「鉄道部」に関しては www.jru7.net/…/view-fukuchiyama20050428.htm に「姫路鉄道部」に関して Railway Division の使用例はあります。
sen.e: The entire line is now under the direct control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama Branch; from April of 1991 to June of 2006, control had been delegated to the Fukuchiyama Branch's Maizuru Railway Division.

The entire line is now under the direct control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama Branch; from April of 1991 to June of 2006, control had been delegated to the Fukuchiyama Branch's Maizuru Railway Division.

sen.j: 京都駅～東舞鶴間に特別急行列車「まいづる」と「タンゴディスカバリー」が合わせて上り7本、下り8本運転されている。
sen.e: Between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station, Limited Express 'Maizuru' and 'Tango Discovery' provide 7 inbound services and 8 outbound ones in all per day.
Between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station, the 'Maizuru' and 'Tango Discovery' Limited Expresses provide 7 inbound services and 8 outbound ones per day.
Between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station, the 'Maizuru' and 'Tango Discovery' Limited Expresses provide 7 inbound services and 8 outbound ones per day.

sen.j: なお、土曜・休日・夏季には「まいづる」のうち1往復が小浜線の小浜駅まで乗り入れ、観光需要に応えている。
sen.e: Furthermore, one round-trip service of 'Maizuru' shares the track of Obama Line from Higashi-Maizuru Station to Obama Station on weekends, holidays and all days during the summer vacation season for satisfying a need of tourists.
sen.cmt: 「乗り入れ」の区間は「東舞鶴駅から」なので、これを補っています。
sen.e: Furthermore, to meet tourist demand on weekends, holidays and during the summer vacation season, the 'Maizuru' provides one round-trip service from Higashi-Maizuru Station to Obama Station on the Obama Line.

Furthermore, to meet tourist demand on weekends, holidays and during the summer vacation season, the 'Maizuru' provides one round-trip service from Higashi-Maizuru Station to Obama Station on the Obama Line.

sen.j: 他の北近畿方面特急と異なり、大阪方面の列車は設定されていない（過去には「エーデル北近畿」として東舞鶴駅まで乗り入れていた時期もあった）。
sen.e: Apart from other limited expresses going for Kitakinki, trains that run on Maizuru Line do not go for Osaka; once the train called 'Edel-kitakinki' coming from Osaka ran on the track of Maizuru Line from Ayabe Station to Higashi-Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: 「エーデル北近畿」は、「大阪方面からやってくる列車だった」ことを示しておかないと不自然だ、と考えこれを補いました。またその乗り入れ区間は「綾部駅から」であり、そう補いました。
sen.e: Unlike other limited expresses to the Kitakinki region, trains on the Maizuru Line do not go to Osaka; though the 'Edel-kitakinki' used to run on the Maizuru Line from Osaka to Higashi-Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: "Apart from"→"Unlike"Deleted "going""for"→"to"Added "region"Deleted "that run"Added "the"Reworded last part of sentence
sen.e: Unlike other limited expresses to the Kitakinki region, trains on the Maizuru Line do not go to Osaka; though the 'Edel-kitakinki' used to run on the Maizuru Line from Osaka to Higashi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: ちなみに東舞鶴～大阪駅間の距離は福知山駅経由 (152.9km) よりも京都経由 (145.4km) のほうが若干短い。
sen.e: Incidentally, the railway distance between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Osaka Station is a bit shorter via Kyoto Station (145.4km) than that via Fukuchiyama Station (152.9km).
Incidentally, the distance between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Osaka Station is a bit shorter via Kyoto Station (145.4km) than via Fukuchiyama Station (152.9km).
Incidentally, the distance between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Osaka Station is slightly shorter via Kyoto Station (145.4 km) than via Fukuchiyama Station (152.9 km).

sen.j: また多くの普通列車が福知山・綾部～東舞鶴間に運転され、一部は「特急リレー号」として綾部駅で山陰本線の特急列車と接続しており、対京都方面では毎時1本の列車頻度を維持している。
sen.e: And many local trains run between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station via Ayabe Station, and some of them called 'Connector Train' connect with the limited express of San'in Main Line at Ayabe Station, so the Maizuru Line operates at least one train for Kyoto Station every hour.

There are also many local trains between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station via Ayabe Station and some of them, called 'Relay Trains,' connect at Ayabe Station with the San'in Main Line limited express, meaning the Maizuru Line operates at least one train for Kyoto Station every hour.
sen.cmt: "Connector Train"→"Relay Trains"-closer to the Japanese, which would be more helpful to tourists"so"→"meaning"
sen.e: There are also many local trains between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station via Ayabe Station and some of them, called 'Relay Trains,' connect at Ayabe Station with the Sanin Main Line limited express, meaning the Maizuru Line operates at least one train for Kyoto Station every hour.

sen.j: また一部の列車が小浜線と直通運転をしているほか、西舞鶴～東舞鶴間の区間列車も1往復ある。
sen.e: And other trains directly connect with Obama Line, and moreover, there exists one round-trip service that runs the section just between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
In addition to the trains that connect directly with the Obama Line, there is one round-trip service on the section between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
In addition to the trains that connect directly with the Obama Line, there is one round-trip service on the section between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: 全線でワンマン運転を実施しているが、一部列車には車掌が乗務することもある。
sen.e: All trains run without a conductor, but some of them occasionally have one.
All trains run with only a driver, although some of them occasionally have a conductor as well..
sen.cmt: "without a conductor"→"with only a driver""but"→"although"Added "as well"
sen.e: All trains run with only a driver, although some occasionally have a conductor as well.
sen.cmt: ”of them”不要。 “some of them occasionally ”-> “ some occasionally ”

sen.j: 以前は、朝に東舞鶴発綾部着の快速列車（途中駅は西舞鶴のみ停車）が1本のみ運行されていたが、2006年10月21日のダイヤ改正以降、快速列車は設定されていない。
sen.e: Formerly, there was only a single service of the rapid train that started Higashi-Maizuru Station and arrived at Ayabe Station (along the way, it stopped only at Nishi-Maizuru Station) in the morning, but since the change of the train schedule on October 21, 2006, there has been none.

Formerly, there was a single rapid train service in the morning from Higashi-Maizuru Station to Ayabe Station, stopping only at Nishi-Maizuru Station, but since the train schedule was changed on October 21, 2006, there has been none.
sen.cmt: Reworded middle of sentence for clarity
sen.e: Formerly, there was a single rapid train service in the morning from Higashi-Maizuru Station to Ayabe Station, stopping only at Nishi-Maizuru Station, but since the train schedule was changed on October 21, 2006, there has been none.

sen.j: 非電化時代は一時期、山陰本線・舞鶴線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線・同北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線を経由して福知山市・綾部市・舞鶴市・宮津市を循環する「四都市循環列車」を運転していたことがあった。
sen.e: Before the era of electrification, there once existed 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities,' which circulated around Fukuchiyama City, Ayabe City, Maizuru City and Miyazu City by way of San'in Main Line, Maizuru Line, and Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyazu & Miyafuku Line.
sen.cmt: 「循環列車」（Circulation Train) の部分だけは app.korail.go.kr/ROOT/cambo-view.cambo?... に記述があります。
sen.e: Before electrification, there once existed 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities,' which circulated around Fukuchiyama City, Ayabe City, Maizuru City and Miyazu City by way of San'in Main Line, Maizuru Line, and Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyazu & Miyafuku Line.

Before electrification, a 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities' once existed,' which circulated around Fukuchiyama City, Ayabe City, Maizuru City and Miyazu City by way of Sanin Main Line, Maizuru Line, and Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyazu & Miyafuku Line.
sen.cmt: 表現スタイル - “there once existed 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities,'”=>”a 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities' once existed,”

sen.j: その経路は次の通り。
sen.e: The route was as follows.
The route was as follows.
The route was as follows.

sen.j: 福知山→（山陰本線）→綾部→（舞鶴線）→西舞鶴→（北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線）→宮津→（北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線）→福知山→（山陰本線）→綾部→（舞鶴線）→西舞鶴
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Station=>(via San'in Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via KTR Miyazu Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via San'in Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station

Fukuchiyama Station=>(via the San'in Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via the KTR Miyazu Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via the KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via San'in the Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station

Fukuchiyama Station=>(via the Sanin Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via the KTR Miyazu Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via the KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via Sanin the Main Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station

sen.j: （上記列車から折り返し）西舞鶴→（舞鶴線）→綾部→（山陰本線）→福知山→（北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線）→宮津→（北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線）→西舞鶴
sen.e: (Doubling back from the last station) Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via Maizuru Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via San'in Main Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via KTR Miyazu Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station

(On the return journey) Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the San'in Main Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via the KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via the KTR Miyazu Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station
sen.cmt: "Doubling back from the last station"→"On the return journey"Added "the" after "via" whenever it occurred
sen.e: (On the return journey) Nishi-Maizuru Station=>(via the Maizuru Line)=>Ayabe Station=>(via the Sanin Main Line)=>Fukuchiyama Station=>(via the KTR Miyafuku Line)=>Miyazu Station=>(via the KTR Miyazu Line)=>Nishi-Maizuru Station

sen.j: さらに現在の嵯峨野線に当てはまる区間（京都～園部間）がまだ非電化だった頃は、当時あった特急・急行とは別に綾部でスイッチバックし、京都と東舞鶴とを直結する普通列車が運転されていたこともあった。
sen.e: In addition, when the present Sagano Line's section (between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station) was yet to be electrified, there existed local trains that switched back at Ayabe Station and directly connected Kyoto Station with Higashi-Maizuru Station, apart from the then limited expresses and expresses.

In addition, before the electrification of the section between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station on what is now the Sagano Line, there were direct local trains between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station, while limited expresses and expresses switched back at Ayabe Station.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence for clarity - Translation 1 had a mistranslation concerning the express trains
sen.e: In addition, before the electrification of the section between Kyoto Station and Sonobe Station on what is now the Sagano Line, there were direct local trains between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station which switched back at Ayabe Station in addition to limited expresses and expresses.

sen.j: 宮津線（現・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線）及び、舞鶴港線（西舞鶴駅から舞鶴港駅（旧・海舞鶴駅）を結んだ貨物専用線・1985年（昭和60年）3月14日で廃止）と貨物列車で共通運用された。
sen.e: This rolling stock was commonly operated as a freight train among former JNR/JR Miyazu Line (the present KTR Miyazu Line), Maizuru Line and Maizuruko Line, and the last line operated exclusively for freight transportation, connected Nishi-Maizuru Station with Maizuruko Station (former Umi-Maizuru Station), and ended the operation on March 14, 1985.

These engines commonly operated as freight trains on the former JNR/JR Miyazu Line (the present day KTR Miyazu Line) and the Maizuruko Line, a line exclusively for freight transportation that connected Nishi-Maizuru Station with Maizuruko Station (formerly Umi-Maizuru Station) and ceased operating on March 14, 1985.

sen.j: 現在は1両（1104号機）が、西日本旅客鉄道のグループ会社嵯峨野観光鉄道に払い下げられ、トロッコ嵯峨駅～トロッコ亀岡駅間で「ロマンチックトレイン嵯峨野」としてトロッコ列車を牽引し、他はJR西日本の豊岡鉄道部に在籍し、団臨列車やレール交換列車などで使用されている。
sen.e: One of the rolling stock (No. 1104) was sold off to Sagano Scenic Railway, which is a group company of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and today, No. 1104 is given a new name, 'Romantic Train Sagano,' and a new role of towing a sight-seeing tram between Saga Torokko Station and Kameoka Torokko Station, and the other rolling stock exists in JR West's Toyo'oka Railway Division and is used as a special train for a group passengers or a train for rail exchange.
sen.cmt: 「鉄道部」に関しては www.jru7.net/…/view-fukuchiyama20050428.htm に「姫路鉄道部」に関して Railway Division の使用例はあります。
sen.e: One of the rolling stock (No. 1104) was sold to Sagano Scenic Railway, a group company of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), given the name 'Romantic Train Sagano' and pulls the sight-seeing train between Saga Torokko Station and Kameoka Torokko Station; and the other rolling stock is owned by JR West's Toyo'oka Railway Division and used as a special train for a group passengers and a rail exchange train.

sen.j: 東舞鶴駅を境に、以南（綾部・福知山方面）が国鉄キハ47形気動車 （両開き2扉 福知山機関区（現・JR西日本福知山運転所）所属）、以北（小浜・敦賀方面）が国鉄キハ48形気動車（片開き2扉 敦賀運転所（現・JR西日本福井地域鉄道部敦賀運転所派出所）所属・北陸本線（近江塩津以東米原及び東海道本線彦根まで）・湖西線（近江今津までの運用）との共通運用）と分かれて運用された。
sen.e: From Higashi-Maizuru Station and southward (in the direction of Ayabe & Fukuchiyama Station), JNR/JR Diesel Cars Type Kiha 47 was commonly operated, which had two pairs of double doors and belonged to Fukuchiyama Railway Yard (the present JR West Fukuchiyama Railway Yard), and from Higashi-Maizuru Station and northward (in the direction of Obama & Tsuruga Station), JNR/JR Diesel Cars Type Kiha 48 was commonly operated, which had two single doors, belonged to Tsuruga Railway Yard (the present JR West Tsuruga Railway Yard's Branch in Fukui Region's Railway Division), and was shared among Maizuru Line, Hokuriku Main Line (from Omi-Shiozu Station to Tokaido Main Line Hikone Station via Maibara Station), and Kosei Line (to Omi-Imazu Station).

sen.j: （キハ82系・キハ181系気動車は向日町運転所（現・JR西日本京都総合運転所)、キハ58・28系気動車の一部とキハ48形気動車は敦賀運転所（現・JR西日本福井地域鉄道部敦賀運転所派出所）所属、他は福知山機関区（現・JR西日本福知山運転所）所属）
sen.e: (The Diesel Cars Series Kiha 82 and 181 belonged to Hyuga Railway Yard, which is the present JR West Kyoto General Railway Yard, and some of the Series Kiha 58 & 28 and all of the Type Kiha 48 belonged to Tsuruga Railway Yard, which is the present JR West Tsuruga Railway Yard's Branch in Fukui Region's Railway Division, and the other rolling stock belonged to Fukuchiyama Railway Yard, which is the present Fukuchiyama Railway Yard.
sen.cmt: 1.B.オリジナル2行目の二重線は訳者が補充しました。２．「運転所」・「機関区」についてはセル91に同じです。３．「鉄道部」については、www.jru7.net/…/view-fukuchiyama20050428.htm に「姫路鉄道部」に関して Railway Division の使用例はあります。
sen.e: (The Kiha Types 82 and 181 belonged to Hyuga Railway Yard, which is now JR West Kyoto General Railway Yard, and some of the Kiha 58 & 28 types and all of the Kiha 48 Type engines belonged to Tsuruga Railway Yard, which is now JR West Fukui Region Railway Division's Tsuruga Railway Branch Yard; the other rolling stock belonged to Fukuchiyama Railway Yard, which is now Fukuchiyama Railway Yard.)

(The Kiha Types 82 and 181 belonged to Hyuga Railway Yard, which is now JR West Kyoto General Railway Yard, and some of the Kiha 58 & 28 types and all of the Kiha 48 Type engines belonged to Tsuruga Railway Yard, which is now JR West Fukui Region Railway Division's Tsuruga Railway Branch Yard; the other rolling stock belonged to Fukuchiyama Railway Yard, which is now JR West Fukuchiyama Railway Yard.)

sen.j: ほぼ全ての列車が全線を走破するが、その利用は京都府北部の中核都市である舞鶴市の代表駅である東舞鶴駅と西舞鶴駅が中心で、そのため西舞鶴駅をのぞく中間駅は利用が低調である。
sen.e: Almost all trains run the entire line, but passengers' use centers on Higashi-Maizuru Station and Nishi-Maizuru Station that are both typical of the core city, Maizuru, in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture, so the other stations in between the starting and terminal stations are used by much less people, except for Nishi-Maizuru Station.

Almost all trains run the entire line, but most passengers use Higashi-Maizuru Station and Nishi-Maizuru Station, both of which serve Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, with the other stations, except Nishi-Maizuru Station, being used by fewer people.
sen.cmt: "passengers' use centers on"→"most passengers use""that are both typical of the"→"both of which serve""the core city"→"a major city""so"→"with"Deleted "in between the starting and terminal stations are""much less"→"fewer"
sen.e: Almost all trains run the entire line, but most passengers use Higashi-Maizuru Station and Nishi-Maizuru Station, both of which serve Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, with the other stations, except Nishi-Maizuru Station, being used by fewer people.

sen.j: なお特別急行列車および特急に接続する普通列車（特急リレー号）は、舞鶴市に国や府の出張官庁、また企業の支店・営業所などが集中している事からビジネス利用が多いが、それ以外の普通列車は通学等の利用が多い。
sen.e: In addition, limited expresses, as well as local trains that connect with limited expresses (Connector Train), are mainly used for a business trip, because the central and prefectural government agencies, as well as companies' branches and offices, are centered in Maizuru City, and the other local trains are mainly used for commuting to school.

In addition, because central and prefectural government agencies, as well as companies' branches and offices, are located in Maizuru City, the limited expresses, as well as the local 'Relay Trains' that connect with them, are mainly used by business commuters, while the other local trains are mainly used for commuting to school.
sen.cmt: Changed word order"(Connector Train)"→"'Relay Trains'""for a business trip"→"by business commuters"---
sen.e: In addition, because central and prefectural government agencies, as well as companies' branches and offices, are located in Maizuru City, the limited expresses, as well as the local 'Relay Trains' that connect with them, are mainly used by business commuters, while the other local trains are mainly used for commuting to school.

sen.j: 1999年（平成12年）10月に電化開業して以後、一貫して利用者数を増やしてきたが、近年は微減傾向である。
sen.e: Since its electrification and restart in October, 1999, Maizuru Line has continued growing in passengers, but the number is declining slightly in recent years.
Following its electrification and reopening in October, 1999, the number of passengers using the Maizuru Line steadily increased, but figures have been declining slightly in recent years.
Following its electrification and reopening in October 1999, the number of passengers using the Maizuru Line steadily increased, but figures have been declining slightly in recent years.

sen.j: 元は阪鶴鉄道・京都鉄道が計画していた路線だが、日露戦争を控え着工を急ぐ必要性から1904年に官設で福知山～綾部～新舞鶴（現在の東舞鶴）間と支線が開通、阪鶴鉄道に貸与されて開業した。
sen.e: Originally, Hankaku Railway Company and Kyoto Railway Company planned to begin the construction of Maizuru Line, but the Japanese government needed to bring the schedule forward with the Russo-Japanese War close at hand, so the line was established by the nation in 1904, when the main line opened between Fukuchiyama Station and Shin-Maizuru Station (the present Higashi-Maizuru Station) via Ayabe Station, as well as the branch line, and these lines were leased to Hankaku Railway Company.

Originally, the Maizuru Line was a joint plan between the Hankaku Railway Company and the Kyoto Railway Company but with the Russo-Japanese War looming, the Japanese government needed to bring the schedule forward, so the government took over and opened the line, which ran from Fukuchiyama Station to Shin-Maizuru Station (present day Higashi-Maizuru Station) via Ayabe Station, and branch lines, in 1904 and then leased it to the Hankaku Railway Company.

Originally, the Maizuru Line was a joint plan between the Hankaku Railway Company and the Kyoto Railway Company but with the Russo-Japanese War looming, the Japanese government needed to bring the schedule forward, so the government took over and opened the line, which ran from Fukuchiyama Station to Shin-Maizuru Station (present day Higashi-Maizuru Station) via Ayabe Station, and branch lines, in 1904 and then leased it to the Hankaku Railway Company.

sen.j: 支線として舞鶴港線（西舞鶴～舞鶴港間）や、出征者や戦場からの引揚者を運んだ中舞鶴線（東舞鶴～中舞鶴間）などを有していたが、1985年までに全て廃止されている。
sen.e: Maizuru Line operated some branch lines, including Maizuruko Line (between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Maizuruko Station) and Naka-Maizuru Line (between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Naka-Maizuru Station) that tranported soldiers and repatriates from battlefields, but these branch lines were all ended by 1985.

The branch lines, including the Maizuruko Line (between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Maizuruko Station) and the Naka-Maizuru Line (between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Naka-Maizuru Station), which transported departing and repatriated soldiers, had all ceased operating by 1985.
sen.cmt: Changed word order"soldiers and repatriate"→"departing and repatriated soldiers""but these branch lines were all ended"→"had all ceased operating"
sen.e: The branch lines, including the Maizuruko Line (between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Maizuruko Station) and the Naka-Maizuru Line (between Higashi-Maizuru Station and Naka-Maizuru Station), which transported departing and repatriated soldiers, had all ceased operating by 1985.

tit.cmt: スポットチェックによる統一

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）11月3日 - 福知山～綾部～新舞鶴間が日本国有鉄道で開業（綾部～新舞鶴間は16.4マイル≒26.39km）。
sen.e: November 3, 1904---Japan National Railways opened a line between Fukuchiyama Station and Shin-Maizuru Station via Ayabe Station (the distance between Ayabe Station and Shin-Maizuru Station is 16.4 miles≒26.39km).

November 3, 1904 --- Line between between Fukuchiyama Station and Shin-Maizuru Station, via Ayabe Station, opened by Japan National Railways (distance between Ayabe Station and Shin-Maizuru Station - 16.4 miles≒26.39km).
sen.cmt: For all sentences in this section I made the English more 'note' style - eg deletion of articles, auxilliary verbs - to make it similar to the Japanese style.
sen.e: November 3, 1904: Line between Fukuchiyama Station and Shin-Maizuru Station, via Ayabe Station, opened by Japan National Railways (distance between Ayabe Station and Shin-Maizuru Station - 16.4 miles ≒ 26.39 km).

sen.j: 同時に阪鶴鉄道に貸与。

Line was leased concurrently to Hankaku Railway Company.

sen.j: 現在の舞鶴線にあたる区間に綾部駅、梅迫駅、舞鶴駅（現在の西舞鶴駅）、新舞鶴駅（現在の東舞鶴駅）が開業。
sen.e: And Ayabe Station, Umezako Station, Maizuru Station (the present Nishi-Maizuru Station) and Shin-Maizuru Station (the present Higashi-Maizuru Station) opened on the railway section that constitutes the present Maizuru Line.

sen.j: 舞鶴～舞鶴海岸荷扱所の軍用線も開業。

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）10月12日 - 線路名称制定、神崎（現在の尼崎駅 (JR西日本)）～福知山～新舞鶴間、舞鶴～舞鶴海岸間などを阪鶴線とする。

October 12, 1909---Line named Hankaku Line for some sections, including from Kanzaki Station (present day JR West Amagasaki Station) to Shin-Maizuru Station, via Fukuchiyama Station and from Maizuru Station to Maizuru Coast Freight Office Station.

sen.e: October 12, 1909: Line named Hankaku Line for some sections, including from Kanzaki Station (present day JR West Amagasaki Station) to Shin-Maizuru Station, via Fukuchiyama Station and from Maizuru Station to Maizuru Coast Freight Office Station.

sen.j: 1912年（明治45年）3月1日 - 綾部～新舞鶴間、舞鶴～舞鶴海岸間を分離し舞鶴線に改称。
sen.e: March 1, 1912---The line separated the section between Ayabe Station and Shin-Maizuru Station from that between Maizuru Station and Maizuru Coast Freight Office Station, and the former was renamed Maizuru Line.

sen.cmt: For all sentences in this section I made the English more 'note' style - eg deletion of articles, auxilliary verbs - to make it similar to the Japanese style.
sen.e: March 1, 1912: Line from Ayabe Station to Shin-Maizuru Station and from Maizuru Station to Maizuru Coast Freight Office Station separated and renamed Maizuru Line.

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年）4月10日 - 舞鶴海岸荷扱所を海舞鶴駅に改称。
sen.e: April 10, 1913---Maizuru Coast Freight Office Station was renamed Umi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: 舞鶴～海舞鶴間の旅客営業を開始。

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年）7月21日 - 支線（中舞鶴線）新舞鶴～中舞鶴間（2.1M≒3.38km）が開業。

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）4月1日 - 営業距離の単位をマイルからメートルに変更（綾部～新舞鶴間 16.4M→26.4km、舞鶴～海舞鶴間 1.0M→1.8km、新舞鶴～中舞鶴間 2.1M→3.4km）。
sen.e: April 1, 1930---The railway distance measure shifted from mile to meter (from Ayabe Station to Shin-Maizuru Station 16.4M=>26.4km; from Maizuru Station to Umi-Maizuru Station 1.0M=>1.8km; from Shin-Maizuru Station to Naka-Maizuru Station 2.1M=>3.4km).
